summary: The "Protecting Our Democracy Act" is a wide-ranging bill aiming to safeguard democratic institutions and processes. It addresses presidential power, checks and balances, government transparency, and election security. Key provisions include measures on presidential self-pardons, financial disclosures for pardon recipients, enforcement of congressional subpoenas, foreign emoluments, whistleblower protections, Hatch Act enforcement, and campaign finance reform, as well as measures addressing ethical guidelines for Inaugural Committees, and addressing foreign interference in elections. The bill also includes the establishment of an inspector general in the Executive Office of the President.
